3: 12Khatami and FrantzThe exponential function represents a faster increase in income over time,while the logarithmic function represents a slower increase in income over time.This allows us to explore the impact of different income patterns on thepoverty line dynamics.The second set of parameters includes the parameters affecting therelationship between income and demand levels. These include the mean andstandard deviation of the income distribution, the eig_to_income_ratio, andthe share_eig_in_demands. We will discuss them in detail later.The third set of parameters includes the parameters affecting thehousehold attributes. These include the emergency_savings_preference andthe n_citizens. The former refers to the percentage of income that householdssave every month, while the latter refers to the total number of householdsin the model.The fourth set of parameters includes the parameters affecting themarket attributes. These include the median_income_level and theshare_eig_in_demands. The former refers to the median income level ofall households, while the latter refers to the proportion of essential investmentgoods in the overall market demands.The fifth set of parameters includes the parameters affecting themarket attributes. These include the median_income_level and theshare_eig_in_demands. The former refers to the median income level ofall households, while the latter refers to the proportion of essential investmentgoods in the overall market demands.The sixth set of parameters includes the parameters affecting themarket attributes. The former refers to the median income level ofall households, while the latter refers to the proportion of essential investmentgoods in the overall market demands.The seventh set of parameters includes the parameters affecting themarket attributes.
